page.title: 18THE PROPOSED NEW BY-PASS.
page.content: A new road plan has been forwarded which will help traffic congestion in Shrewsbury. The route will, at one point, pass just to the west of Gains Park housing estate, which is on our Domesday Block. We have studied the proposed route in relation to the estate. The road would provide quick and easy access from the estate to such places as Telford. It would be particularly helpful for getting to the Telford Shopping Centre. At present cars have to use an already busy by-pass(built in 1931) or travel through the town centre itself. Possible disadvantages to residents of the estate would be from noise and pollution. Alternative routes are also under consideration, namely the Yellow Plan, the Red plan and the Anti-Green Plan. The results of a public enquiry should be known in August 1985.
